title: LabOps
paragraphOne: The Data Diversity Lab performs its research operations with a foundation based on the use of free and open source software (FOSS) to facilitate communication, enable cross border collaboration, increase Open Access and Open Research efforts, and maintaining sovereignty over one's own personal and scientific data. Below you can explore our current and evolving set of tools that help support our operations.

numberedCards.title: Mattermost
numberedCards.description: Mattermost is a free and open-source, self-hostable, online chat service with integrated file sharing. In the Data Diversity Lab, we have replaced Discord with Mattermost as an alternative for efficient communication, planning and collaboration.

numberedCards.title: ownCloud
numberedCards.description: ownCloud is a free and open-source, self-hostable project for content collaboration, sharing, and syncing files. In the Data Diversity Lab, we have replaced One Drive and Google Drive for ownCloud.

numberedCards.title: OnlyOffice Docs
numberedCards.description: OnlyOffice is a free and open-source collaborative system developed to manage and create documents, spreadsheets and PDFs. In the Data Diversity Lab, we have replaced various aspects of Microsoft 365, more specifically the now phased out "office" suites.

numberedCards.title: Radicale
numberedCards.description: Radicale is a free and open source, self-hostable, calendar and address book server. It uses and implements CalDAV standards. When used in conjunction with open source clients such as Thunderbird and Evolution Calendar, it creates a strong replacement for classic closed-source clients and services such as Google Calendar.

paragraphTwo: We encourage other labs to use these powerful suite of tools to complement, enhance and accelerate research.
